meanings.definition: A member of a small independent group taking part in irregular fighting, typically against larger regular forces.
meanings.sent1: The guerilla hid in the forest, waiting to ambush the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The guerilla fighters used hit-and-run tactics to outsmart the army.
meanings.sent3: The guerilla brought a slingshot to a gunfight - talk about being creative!
meanings.sent4: In the business world, she was a guerilla, disrupting the market with innovative strategies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lone guerilla standing against a mighty army is etched in history.

meanings.definition: A form of warfare in which a small group of combatants use mobile tactics to fight a larger and less mobile traditional military.
meanings.sent1: The guerilla unit swiftly moved through the jungle, striking the enemy's supply lines.
meanings.sent2: The guerilla tactics proved effective in wearing down the enemy's defenses.
meanings.sent3: The guerilla soldiers played hide-and-seek with the enemy tanks - and won!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like guerilla attacks, hitting hard and fast in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The guerilla warfare of the rebels kept the larger army on edge, never knowing where the next strike would come from.
